## Description {#details}

Generic implementation of equivalence classes through the use Tarjan&#39;s efficient union-find algorithm.

<Link id="l00025" /><CodeLine lineNumber="25"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00026" /><CodeLine lineNumber="26"><Highlight kind="comment">/// EquivalenceClasses - This represents a collection of equivalence classes and</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00027" /><CodeLine lineNumber="27"><Highlight kind="comment">/// supports three efficient operations: insert an element into a class of its</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00028" /><CodeLine lineNumber="28"><Highlight kind="comment">/// own, union two classes, and find the class for a given element.  In</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00029" /><CodeLine lineNumber="29"><Highlight kind="comment">/// addition to these modification methods, it is possible to iterate over all</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00030" /><CodeLine lineNumber="30"><Highlight kind="comment">/// of the equivalence classes and all of the elements in a class.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00031" /><CodeLine lineNumber="31"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00032" /><CodeLine lineNumber="32"><Highlight kind="comment">/// This implementation is an efficient implementation that only stores one copy</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00033" /><CodeLine lineNumber="33"><Highlight kind="comment">/// of the element being indexed per entry in the set, and allows any arbitrary</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00034" /><CodeLine lineNumber="34"><Highlight kind="comment">/// type to be indexed (as long as it can be ordered with operator&lt; or a</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00035" /><CodeLine lineNumber="35"><Highlight kind="comment">/// comparator is provided).</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00036" /><CodeLine lineNumber="36"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00037" /><CodeLine lineNumber="37"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Here is a simple example using integers:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00038" /><CodeLine lineNumber="38"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00039" /><CodeLine lineNumber="39"><Highlight kind="comment">/// \\code</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00040" /><CodeLine lineNumber="40"><Highlight kind="comment">///  EquivalenceClasses&lt;int&gt; EC;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00041" /><CodeLine lineNumber="41"><Highlight kind="comment">///  EC.unionSets(1, 2);                // insert 1, 2 into the same set</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00042" /><CodeLine lineNumber="42"><Highlight kind="comment">///  EC.insert(4); EC.insert(5);        // insert 4, 5 into own sets</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00043" /><CodeLine lineNumber="43"><Highlight kind="comment">///  EC.unionSets(5, 1);                // merge the set for 1 with 5&#39;s set.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00044" /><CodeLine lineNumber="44"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00045" /><CodeLine lineNumber="45"><Highlight kind="comment">///  for (EquivalenceClasses&lt;int&gt;::iterator I = EC.begin(), E = EC.end();</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00046" /><CodeLine lineNumber="46"><Highlight kind="comment">///       I != E; ++I) &#123;           // Iterate over all of the equivalence sets.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00047" /><CodeLine lineNumber="47"><Highlight kind="comment">///    if (!I-&gt;isLeader()) continue;   // Ignore non-leader sets.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00048" /><CodeLine lineNumber="48"><Highlight kind="comment">///    for (EquivalenceClasses&lt;int&gt;::member&#95;iterator MI = EC.member&#95;begin(I);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00049" /><CodeLine lineNumber="49"><Highlight kind="comment">///         MI != EC.member&#95;end(); ++MI)   // Loop over members in this set.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00050" /><CodeLine lineNumber="50"><Highlight kind="comment">///      cerr &lt;&lt; &#42;MI &lt;&lt; &quot; &quot;;  // Print member.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00051" /><CodeLine lineNumber="51"><Highlight kind="comment">///    cerr &lt;&lt; &quot;\\n&quot;;   // Finish set.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00052" /><CodeLine lineNumber="52"><Highlight kind="comment">///  &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00053" /><CodeLine lineNumber="53"><Highlight kind="comment">/// \\endcode</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00054" /><CodeLine lineNumber="54"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00055" /><CodeLine lineNumber="55"><Highlight kind="comment">/// This example prints:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00056" /><CodeLine lineNumber="56"><Highlight kind="comment">///   4</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00057" /><CodeLine lineNumber="57"><Highlight kind="comment">///   5 1 2</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00058" /><CodeLine lineNumber="58"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00059" /><CodeLine lineNumber="59"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">template</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &lt;</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">class</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> ElemTy, </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">class</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> Compare = std::less&lt;ElemTy&gt;&gt;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00060" /><CodeLine lineNumber="60" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/equivalenceclasses"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">class </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/equivalenceclasses/#a9dc0b27026bcd7953eada1a9f3c6d1c8">EquivalenceClasses</a> &#123;</Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00061" /><CodeLine lineNumber="61"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// ECValue - The EquivalenceClasses data structure is just a set of these.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00062" /><CodeLine lineNumber="62"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Each of these represents a relation for a value.  First it stores the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00063" /><CodeLine lineNumber="63"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// value itself, which provides the ordering that the set queries.  Next, it</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00064" /><CodeLine lineNumber="64"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// provides a &quot;next pointer&quot;, which is used to enumerate all of the elements</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00065" /><CodeLine lineNumber="65"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// in the unioned set.  Finally, it defines either a &quot;end of list pointer&quot; or</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00066" /><CodeLine lineNumber="66"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// &quot;leader pointer&quot; depending on whether the value itself is a leader.  A</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00067" /><CodeLine lineNumber="67"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// &quot;leader pointer&quot; points to the node that is the leader for this element,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00068" /><CodeLine lineNumber="68"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// if the node is not a leader.  A &quot;end of list pointer&quot; points to the last</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00069" /><CodeLine lineNumber="69"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// node in the list of members of this list.  Whether or not a node is a</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00070" /><CodeLine lineNumber="70"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// leader is determined by a bit stolen from one of the pointers.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00071" /><CodeLine lineNumber="71"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">class </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">ECValue &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00242" /><CodeLine lineNumber="242" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/equivalenceclasses/#abf907bded6ddfb5a9bc7431f159b0046"><Highlight kind="normal">  member&#95;iterator <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/equivalenceclasses/#abf907bded6ddfb5a9bc7431f159b0046">unionSets</a>(member&#95;iterator L1, member&#95;iterator L2) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00243" /><CodeLine lineNumber="243"><Highlight kind="normal">    <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/silowercontrolflow-cpp/#a4868c5d81c5ccc98c47aeab6244346a0">assert</a>(L1 != <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/equivalenceclasses/#a355ac386262a099693abd5b51c60e137">member&#95;end</a>() &amp;&amp; L2 != <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/equivalenceclasses/#a355ac386262a099693abd5b51c60e137">member&#95;end</a>() &amp;&amp; </Highlight><Highlight kind="stringliteral">&quot;Illegal inputs!&quot;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00244" /><CodeLine lineNumber="244"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (L1 == L2) </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> L1;   </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Unifying the same two sets, noop.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00245" /><CodeLine lineNumber="245"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00246" /><CodeLine lineNumber="246"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Otherwise, this is a real union operation.  Set the end of the L1 list to</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00247" /><CodeLine lineNumber="247"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// point to the L2 leader node.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00248" /><CodeLine lineNumber="248"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> ECValue &amp;L1LV = &#42;L1.Node, &amp;L2LV = &#42;L2.Node;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00249" /><CodeLine lineNumber="249"><Highlight kind="normal">    L1LV.getEndOfList()-&gt;setNext(&amp;L2LV);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00250" /><CodeLine lineNumber="250"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00251" /><CodeLine lineNumber="251"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Update L1LV&#39;s end of list pointer.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00252" /><CodeLine lineNumber="252"><Highlight kind="normal">    L1LV.Leader = L2LV.getEndOfList();</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00253" /><CodeLine lineNumber="253"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00254" /><CodeLine lineNumber="254"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Clear L2&#39;s leader flag:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00255" /><CodeLine lineNumber="255"><Highlight kind="normal">    L2LV.Next = L2LV.getNext();</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00256" /><CodeLine lineNumber="256"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00257" /><CodeLine lineNumber="257"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// L2&#39;s leader is now L1.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00258" /><CodeLine lineNumber="258"><Highlight kind="normal">    L2LV.Leader = &amp;L1LV;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00259" /><CodeLine lineNumber="259"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> L1;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00260" /><CodeLine lineNumber="260"><Highlight kind="normal">  &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00261" /><CodeLine lineNumber="261"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00262" /><CodeLine lineNumber="262"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// isEquivalent - Return true if V1 is equivalent to V2. This can happen if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00263" /><CodeLine lineNumber="263"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// V1 is equal to V2 or if they belong to one equivalence class.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
